story:
The Artist & The Production

I am a professional belly dance and fusion artist based in Austin, Texas with a dance career spanning more than 30 years and numerous productions.

On October 24 & 25, 2014, I will be presenting an extraordinary dance production titled "Ode to the Elements Forever" at the Vortex Repertory Company Theatre in Austin. This production is a revival based on original music and dance from a previous production I did 25 years ago titled "Ode to the Elements." This rendition will have a company of 21 dancers and 5 musicians.  It will be a theatrical,  joyous, and deeply-moving performance experience for dance, art and music fans near and far.

A dear friend once told me,"Helene, when you get a wild hair, you really get a wild hair and follow through!" While in my dance studio in March of this year, I realized how much I wanted to bring this show back to the stage with the same concepts but presented in new ways. Art evolves and I want to reflect that evolution.  The response from performers who wanted to share in my vision was absolutely overwhelming! So onward I march and I would be honored and humbled to have your support in bringing this performing arts vision back to the stage. 

A Few Words From the Producer


The Elements of "Elements"

The original production had a cast of dancers, but a large part of the show was my own solo performances. In this new incarnation, I turn my previous solos into large ensemble choreography pieces.  I will be personally presenting a vibrant, high energy solo in which I reprise movement from my 37 year career as a dancer and choreographer.

Vintage Music...

Side A of our original music "cassette" (also called "Ode to the Elements") is used for a choreography suite that explores and honors the Five Elements of Earth, Air, Water, Fire and Spirit.

Side B is another large ensemble choreography called "Persephone's Ascent." This piece reinterprets the ancient Greek myth of the goddess Persephone and her struggle with Demeter and Hades. 

The final section of the show will be live with dancers and musicians creatively coming together to express the Elements and the connection that we have with ourselves, each other, and our planet.  

Rehearsals so far have been beautifully inspired with the cast contributing brilliant ideas to this vision. I am incredibly excited and I CAN'T WAIT to share this with you!

Where Your Money Will Go

Ode to the Elements Forever is in need of $10,000 to realize the show's full potential. Funding will cover every part of production costs from theater rental, technical staff, videotaping, costuming (a LARGE part of the expenses due to the size of the cast), programs, advertising, and of course payment for the dancers. If you enjoy the performing arts, this is a great opportunity to support non-mainstream artists promoting the arts in their local community. Any contribution amount is deeply appreciated and will be put to work!

We have many perks for you:  program mentions and dedications, tickets to the show, CDs, DVDs and more!
I have a successful history of producing many large events that span several decades: 
Blue Waves (1985)
Ode to the Elements (1989)
From East to West (1991)
Rhythms from the Great Heart (1993) 
Belly Dance Seasonal Shows (2001-2004)
The Annual Middle Eastern Dance Choreography Competitions (2005-2011)
Plus, numerous recitals and showcases as professor of dance at Austin Community College. Rest assured your contributions will be managed well and will be supporting the performing arts in meaningful ways!
Ode to the Elements Forever promises to dazzle, captivate and move you on many levels. It is a vibrant cornucopia of sight, sound, and feeling.

Join us in this artistic vision and celebrate life!

Tickets are on sale now!

http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/868245

We are just getting started, and your support will help us prepare to give back to the community. We are working on acquiring those super comfy seats and light/sound technology that will help us to tell great stories, and ultimately give MORE back to the community once they begin. 

Regardless if you can donate today or not, the fact that you are interested in seeing what Giving Tree Theater is working on makes us HAPPY! We can't wait for you to sit in a comfy seat and enjoy one of our great stories!

-Richie and Heather


Do you love the perks but just want to donate directly? That's okay, click the button below to donate securely online, or contact Giving Tree Theater at (319) 213-7956 to arrange a donation via check. Thank you!

story:
Niranthara Ranga Utsav

‘NIRANTHARA RANGA UTSAV-14’, A National Theatre Festival from December 30th 2014 to January 3rd 2015 at Kalamandir, Mysuru, India.This is a National Theatre Festival. A little contribution to Theatre from Niranthara Foundation.  This five day theatre festival will see theatre groups and theatre experts from around India participating and performing their best theatre productions and making this festival a main cultural event of Karnataka and India as well. 

This is an alter to materialise and understand the regional theatre movement of Karnataka and other states of India. We are aiming at understanding the expressions and dynamics of different regional theatre movements of India. It can be seen as a metaphor for cultural revival and recreation with the coming of many social intellectuals, thinkers, theatre stalwarts and young aspirants of theatre and knowledge, witnessing the staging of some of the best theatre productions, folk forms of the nation and seminars with the objectives of cultural analysis, discussions and introspection. This event can see leaping possibilities at the cultural and societal level in Karnataka as the youth, the prime conscience of this nation will be the major audience as well.

We are bringing in plays like:

  • Shivarathri  (Kannada), Directed by Shri. Chidambararao Jambe 

  • Aashadathil Ek Divas (Marathi) Directed by Atul Pethe

  • Mukthiar Ali - Rajasthani Sufi Singing

  •  Prathima Naatakam (Malayalam)  directed by K. N. Panicker’s

  • Koodala Sangama (Kannada), Directed by M M Suguna

Folk performances by:

Indigenous Artists from in and around Karnataka singing Thatvapadas and Kabir songs.

Seminars presided by: Theatre activists like Shri. Prasanna, Shri. K. V. Akshara, Shri. Suresh Anagalli, Dr. Chandrashekhara Kambara, Dr. Marula Siddappa, Shri. C. Basavalingaiah, Shri. Chidambararao Jambe, Shri. D. S. Chowgule and many young aspirants of theatre, dwelling upon the themes:

· Theatre Criticism

· Art and Theatre: Interrelation

Thousands of people will attend this festival and this will be our 6th successful theatre festival in Mysuru.


The aim of our campaign is raise partial amount of the entire budget needed to organize this festival of a national appeal. Your great gesture in contributing for this festival will empower us in thriving more and more for many profound expressions in our journey to be treaded for social cause which is our prime motto.  

Niranthara Foundation(R), Mysuru

Niranthara Foundation aims at and strives as a cultural medium to strengthen our cultural foundation. For many years now Niranthara Foundation has been active on a varity fronts such as theatre, folk art, literature and environment, with a clear vision and social commitments. To realize this vision Niranthara has organized many theatre workshops, conducted theatre camps for college students, organized seminars on theater and literature , conducted regular theater Jathas in and around Karnataka. Niranthara Foundation has garnered the adulation of people in cultural field with its continuous theatre activities. The programmes conducted by the organization have been successful in mirroring the society oriented traditions and creating cultural awareness in the younger generation. The organization works as a quasi-repertory and has regular involvement of people ranging from amateur artists, college students and artists from working class. Our aim is to initiate theatre movement by bringing together interested artists from all social strata. Our efforts are in the direction of not only giving importance to the talent in the younger generation through the medium of theatre but also bring awareness about land, water, nation and culture and inculcate the ideals of a clean society, higher values, clear goals and purpose. Our organization has the support and guidance of theatre experts, scholars, experts in the field of education and well known artists in making our programs creative.

Her you can look and like our facebook page for some more details about our past activities and future events... 

 www.facebook.com/niranthara.mysore

http://nirantharamysore.org/

You can always write to us on niranthara.rangautsav@gmail.com and call us on +9197405 83783

What we Assure

We are not merely assuring you in terms of numbers and mileage for your sponsorship,  but surely promise that you will feel extremely proud for being associated with us.
Other Ways You Can Help
You can still be a big support for us even if you cannot contribute in terms of money.
  • Share this word with  your friends and ask them  to pass the word  and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Give a flow to this campaign by sharing the links of Indiegogo and facebook page of our campaign...
story_txt:
Niranthara Ranga Utsav 
‘NIRANTHARA RANGA UTSAV-14’, A National Theatre Festival from December 30th 2014 to January 3rd 2015 at Kalamandir, Mysuru, India.This is a National Theatre Festival. A
little contribution to Theatre from Niranthara Foundation.  This five day theatre festival will see theatre groups and theatre experts from around India participating and performing their best theatre productions and making this festival a main cultural event of Karnataka and India as well. 
This is an alter to materialise and understand the regional theatre movement of Karnataka and other states of India. We are aiming at understanding the expressions and dynamics of different regional theatre movements of India. It can be seen as a metaphor for cultural revival and recreation with the coming of many social intellectuals, thinkers, theatre stalwarts and young aspirants of theatre and knowledge, witnessing the staging of some of the best theatre productions, folk forms of the nation and seminars with the objectives of cultural analysis, discussions and introspection. This event can see leaping possibilities at the cultural and societal level in Karnataka as the youth, the prime conscience of this nation will be the major audience as well.
We are bringing in plays like:

Shivarathri  (Kannada), Directed by Shri. Chidambararao Jambe

story:
MY STORY:

Hey Fam,

My name is Dominique Morisseau and I am an emerging playwright living in New York City! This year has been amazing for me. I had the honor to develop my work with the Public's Emerging Writer's Group (http://www.publictheater.org/content/view/154/) and the Lark Play Development Center's Playwrights' Workshop (http://www.larktheatre.org/),and I have grown so much as an artist, learned so much about myself, and cultivated my craft. I've walked away more confident in my artistry as a dramatist. I am so thankful for the opportunities I've had to continue to develop my work in these recent years, but now I'm ready to get out there!

My new play SUNSET BABYis being produced by the Gate Theatre in London, UK September 19 - October 20, 2012. SUNSET BABY is about a former black revolutionary Kenyatta Shakur and the relationship with his estranged daughter Nina. The play explores the gaps between generations, movements, and the effect that absent fathers have on their young daughters. That dynamic is so rarely examined on the stage: we usually talk about the effect it has on young black boys, but what about our girls?

When former Kenyatta reaches out to Nina shortly after her mother’s passing, he has high hopes of reuniting and burying the wounds of the past.  What he finds instead is a vengeful daughter who embodies everything contrary to the movement he fought in.  If Kenyatta truly wants to reconcile the past, he must first conquer his most challenging revolution of all--- fatherhood.


I am over the moon that SUNSET BABY (www.sunsetbaby.com) will be getting its world premiere in London, but I need your help in concquering a major obstacle. Unfortunately, due to recent cutbacks in the UK's government funding for the arts, the theatre will not be able to fund me so that I may participate in the full rehearsal process for my play (starting August 13th through opening, September 13th).

As a playwright working on a world premiere, it is integral that I am present. I want to be a dramturgical source for the actors in terms of the US history interwoven in the piece, the specific language of East New York and the general world of the play. I think it would benefit both the the actors and director, as we work together to  bring the work to life as authentically as possible.

I am in need of $5,500 of funding for accommodations, transportation, and a food allowance. The impact that it would have on my life as an emerging playwright is inmeasurable. The rehearsal process of a new work is a fragile and exciting one and I want to be there for every second. I would learn how to be a "working writer" and not just an "emerging writer."

Most importantly, a bridge is being built across the ocean that unites the US and UK theatre worlds in an inextricable bond. This is not only for me, but a way to continue the dialogue that political theatres on both sides of the pond are having not only with each other, but with the world!

Be part of the bridge!

  • For those who give  $25 of support, you will received a special shout out on facebook and twitter
  • For those who give $50 of support, you will receive a signed poster from the London production
  • For those who give $75 of support, you will receive a signed copy of the London production manuscript
  • And for those who contribute a whopping $100 of support, you will receive a signed copy of the play script, published by Oberon

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, there are other ways you can help!

  • If your're in the New York area, please come and attend the reading May 21, 2012 @ 7pm of SUNSET BABY in the Lark Play Development Center's Playwright's Workshop Play Festival. Reserve your seat here (http://boxoffice.printtixusa.com/lark/eventcalendar)
  • If you're in the New York City area, attend a private fundraiser on May 19, 2012 at @ 8pm WHERE: Rock & Rose -- E. 53rd St. btwn 1st and 2nd Avenues (6, E, M trains to 53rd St., walk one avenue over)
  • Share my campaign on facebook and twitter!


MORE ABOUT ME:

Dominique Morisseau, Writer and Actress, is a current member of the 2011 Public Theater Emerging Writer’s Group, the Women’s Project Playwrights Lab, and a 2011-2012 Lark Playwrights Workshop fellow.   Her play, Detroit ’67, will receive a world premiere in the 2012-2013 season of the Public Theater and the Classical Theatre of Harlem.   In September 2012, her play, Sunset Baby, will have its world premiere at the Gate Theater in London, UK.  Dominique’s inaugural play, Follow Me To Nellie’s, was developed at the 2010 O’Neill National Playwrights Conference and produced at Premiere Stages in July 2011.  As an actress, Dominique originated the role of Camae in the Lark's original workshop production of Katori Hall's The Mountaintop,and has also performed with BET/Viacom, The Lark, Women’s Project, McCarter Theater, NYSAF, and MCC Theater.   As a poet, she has rocked stages with The Last Poets, Sonia Sanchez, Jessica Care Moore, and musical artists Shanice and Rahsaan Patterson.  Her work has been showcased at the Kennedy Center and featured on MBC Networks series, “Spoken”.   She has been published in “Signifyin’ Harlem” – a literary journal, and in the NY Times bestseller- “Chicken Soup for the African American Soul”.  Dominique is a Jane Chambers Playwriting Award Honoree, a two-time NAACP Image Award recipient, a finalist for the PONY prize, a runner-up for the 2011 Princess Grace Award, and a recipient of the Elizabeth George commission from South Coast Rep.

story:
Mad Cow Theatre, downtown Orlando's professional theatre, is presenting Dreamgirls. The show already has the best talent from the Central Florida region (and beyond), and we’re thrilled to be bringing our production to the stage!

The highest-quality production depends on more than talent: the director, the set, the choreography and musicians, and, of course, the costumes.

We've got most of those things for Dreamgirls, but here's where you come in. The costumes for the Dreams must be absolutely show-stopping, and we need your help to raise $5,000 to Dress the Dreams!

While that might seem like a lot of money for clothes, shoes, and wigs, the Dreams’ costumes are really so much more than those things.

Not only will each Dream have several costume changes, but all of them are custom-designed and perfectly tailored to the individual performer. They need to be superb designs, be made of good fabrics and materials, and on top of that, they’ve got to stand up to the wear and tear of day-in, day-out movement on the stage.

Who wants to see Effie sing "And I Am Telling You..." in rags? Nobody.

Please help us make sure that the Dreams stand out in their costumes, making this production of Dreamgirls the best from top to bottom, head to toe!

 

What We Need & What You Get

This $5,000 will completely costume the three Dreamgirls: Effie, Deena, and Lorrell. It will help cover the expenses of our costume designers, the fabrics/materials, and the labor and construction of the garments. If we don’t reach our entire goal, whatever we do earn will still go to outfitting the Dreams; if we go above our goal (yes!), it will go to help cover the costumes of the rest of the very large cast.

We want to reward your generosity, of course. Take a peek at our perks on the right side of the page! We have many levels of giving, and even the smallest amount will make a big difference to us. We won’t be able to do this without you!

If you’re not able to give, you’ll still be able to help – spread the word! Let your friends and family know about this campaign. We appreciate it!

 

The Impact

Mad Cow Theatre is a nonprofit organization, and only a portion of our revenue comes from ticket sales. We depend on donors like you to help keep our productions going.

Mad Cow is in the middle of its 16th season, and we’ve been bringing the highest quality of performing arts to the region for all these years. We pride ourselves on being an important and beneficial part of the community. Dreamgirls is going to be an amazing event, and we want all of Central Florida to share in it!

With your help, we can make Dress the Dreams successful. Our mission is to celebrate and enrich people through theatre and the performing arts. Here’s your chance to help us continue that tradition!

Thank you!
THE COWS

story:
No Sleep November

We are setting up the first of what we hope are many events to show off the playwrights of Kansas City. We're taking 5 Playwrights, 15 Actors, locking them in overnight at The Living Room Theater and perform 5 new plays the following day.

  • GVB Theatricals and Play On Productions are companies devoted to the production of new work.  The Living Room Theater is devoted to cutting edge entertainment.
  • This is a project dedicated to showing off Kansas City's playwriting power and to challenge ourselves to do stellar work. And to have a great time doing it.
  • By donating to this campaign, you will allow us to feed and house playwrights, actors and staff, plus allow us to offer tickets on a "pay what you want" basis. 

This is bound to be a fun, raucous, entertaining night of theater that you'll want to see.

Please Donate.

So why the Indiegogo campaign?:

  • Playwrights and actors need to eat and drink. They're picky that way. We need them well fed and happy, because we need them to create a complete 15 minute theater piece in 24 hours. 
  • Contributors get to come see the show and party with us. We won't kick everyone out until one the night before! You go home and sleep and come back the next night to see what we put together while you were gone.
  • Indiegogo takes a bigger chunk if we don't reach our goal. And if we don't reach our goal, we reach into the coffers of our production companies, using funds needed for future productions.

The Impact

Your contribution will help a lot:

  • This project is valuable to the Kansas City arts and theater scene. This town has been creating a unique voice for for itself. This is our chance to show it off.
  • All the people involved have been major contributors to the creation of a strong, vibrant Kansas City Theater. Let's keep it going, keep it moving, let us show what we can do.
  • This happens November 17th and 18th. Grab your chance to be part of this historic event..

Other Ways You Can Help

Please give if you can, but if you can't:

  • Let people know how they can contribute.
  • Talk it up!
  • Share, share, share!

story:
What is Wan Smolbag Theatre?

Wan Smolbag Theatre is a non-government organization based in Vanuatu but operating all over the South Pacific. We started as a group of 15 voluntary actors in 1989, then 5 paid actors, now in 2014 we have about 150 full and part-time staff. 

Over the past 25 years, Wan Smolbag has played a critical role in the wellbeing of Vanuatu communities through: impressive theatre productions, six seasons of a soap opera and numerous feature films popular across the region, educational resources used across the Pacific, governance programmes, an ever-expanding environmental network, three reproductive health clinics, youth and sport programs and an innovative nutrition centre.

Coupled with structured workshops facilitated by actors, the organization uses drama to inform, raise awareness and encourage public discussion on a range of contemporary health, lifestyle, environment and governance issues. These address every imaginable theme from waste management and electoral rights to domestic violence and AIDS. To find out more go to our website - wansmolbag.org or facebook page - facebook.com/WanSmolbag.

Did you enjoy the FIRE SHOW?

If you recently visited Vanuatu or are regulars at the Mele Beach Bar, you have probably seen the Fire Show performed by Vanua Fire. It started as a collaboration between the Mele Beach Bar and Wan Smolbag Youth Centre and now the group of around 18 young men and women perform 9 shows a week at different resorts around Port Vila. They are a hit at weddings, charity fundraisers and Independence celebrations. This is just one of many examples of creative job opportunities Wan Smolbag promotes. Did you know the youth centre has over 2,000 members pace through its doors every year to participate in a variety of specialist classes. Membership is 100vt ($1) for the year and the centre has become almost a second home for youth all around Port Vila, especially those who don't go or haven't been to school.

An international Theatre Festival, really?

Yes! It's to celebrate 25 years of our work in Vanutu and the Pacific region and will be held from the 26th of June to the 6th of July. It's going to take a lot of work to get organised but the chance to have international artists perform in Vanuatu really can't be missed. It follows the success of the 2009 festival that saw artists from Australia, New Caledonia, New Zealand, England and the Solomon Islands perform around Port Vila and at Wan Smolbag Hoas. 

If all goes to plan.....

Artists from New Zealand, Australia, New Caledonia, Samoa will be invited to perform at the festival which will be held on the 26th of June to the 6th of July. it will start with an impressive opening ceremony and a march through Port Vila (Vanuatu's Capital).

There will be a week of show and workshops lead by artists in their specialist area of performance at WSB Youth Centre, schools and communities.

We see this festival as an opportunity for collective learning and sharing with international theatre groups and to create a unique opportunity for Wan Smolbag, youth, and the public to experience contemporary international theatre here in Vanuatu! 

The more the merrier

As festivals go, bigger is normally better. The more acts we can attract the more inspirational theatre we can have performed in Vanuatu. Of course we are looking at a much larger figure than $9,500. It's more like $50,000 but we have to be realistic as to what's achievable online. We are also currently applying for grants and seeking local sponsors to help with the festival costs.

The money you donate will go towards meals, transport and accommodation for artists hoping to perform - the more money we raise, the more artists we can have at the festival. 

Not just that warm fuzzy feeling.....

Ok ok, so you want something more than just a pat on the back and a good nights sleep knowing you have made a difference.... you want great rewards!

There is something for everyone like Postcards from Vanuatu written by WSB actors or Love Patrol DVD's and T-shirts,  even fire breathing or island cooking classes. Yes they're all just a bit of fun but it's the least we can do to say thank you for  your donation. For any donors outside of Vanuatu who might not be visiting anytime soon, don't worry Skype is a wonderful thing so I'm sure we can make something happen for you.

It's over to you now!

Any donation is greatly appreciated and without it we couldn't pull this off. Of course it doesn't have to be financial, can you provide in country support for the artist? Do you have a spare room at your hotel/guest house that you wouldn't mind donating to a good cause? Can you supply meals for the artists or help us with transport - there is a lot to organise and anything is appreciated. If so please get in touch via email - rhinton@wansmolbag.org

No pennies to your name?

Not a problem, all we ask is that you share, tweet, blog, post and spread the word about what we are doing and how we need help to make it happen. It's hopefully going to be a wonderful festival, don't you want to be able to say that you helped it happen?
story_txt: What is Wan Smolbag Theatre?Wan Smolbag Theatre is a non-government organization based in Vanuatu but operating all over the South Pacific. We started as a group of 15 voluntary actors in 1989, then 5 paid actors, now in 2014 we have about 150 full and part-time staff. Over the past 25 years, Wan Smolbag has played a critical role in the wellbeing of Vanuatu communities through: impressive theatre productions, six seasons of a soap opera and numerous feature films popular across the region, educational resources used across the Pacific, governance programmes, an ever-expanding environmental network, three reproductive health clinics, youth and sport programs and an innovative nutrition centre.Coupled with structured workshops facilitated by actors, the organization uses drama to inform, raise awareness and encourage public discussion on a range of contemporary health, lifestyle, environment and governance issues. These address every imaginable theme from waste management and electoral rights to domestic violence and AIDS. To find out more go to our website - wansmolbag.org or facebook page - facebook.com/WanSmolbag.Did you enjoy the FIRE SHOW?If you recently visited Vanuatu or are regulars at the Mele Beach Bar, you have probably seen the Fire Show performed by Vanua Fire. It started as a collaboration between the Mele Beach Bar and Wan Smolbag Youth Centre and now the group of around 18 young men and women perform 9 shows a week at different resorts around Port Vila. They are a hit at weddings, charity fundraisers and Independence celebrations. This is just one of many examples of creative job opportunities Wan Smolbag promotes. Did you know the youth centre has over 2,000 members pace through its doors every year to participate in a variety of specialist classes. Membership is 100vt ($1) for the year and the centre has become almost a second home for youth all around Port Vila, especially those who don't go or haven't been to school.An international Theatre Festival, really?Yes! It's to celebrate 25 years of our work in Vanutu and the Pacific region and will be held from the 26th of June to the 6th of July. It's going to take a lot of work to get organised but the chance to have international artists perform in Vanuatu really can't be missed. It follows the success of the 2009 festival that saw artists from Australia, New Caledonia, New Zealand, England and the Solomon Islands perform around Port Vila and at Wan Smolbag Hoas. If all goes to plan.....Artists from New Zealand, Australia, New Caledonia, Samoa will be invited to perform at the festival which will be held on the 26th of June to the 6th of July. it will start with an impressive opening ceremony and a march through Port Vila (Vanuatu's Capital).There will be a week of show and workshops lead by artists in their specialist area of performance at WSB Youth Centre, schools and communities.We see this festival as an opportunity for collective learning and sharing with international theatre groups and to create a unique opportunity for Wan Smolbag, youth, and the public to experience contemporary international theatre here in Vanuatu! The more the merrierAs festivals go, bigger is normally better. The more acts we can attract the more inspirational theatre we can have performed in Vanuatu. Of course we are looking at a much larger figure than $9,500. It's more like $50,000 but we have to be realistic as to what's achievable online. We are also currently applying for grants and seeking local sponsors to help with the festival costs.The money you donate will go towards meals, transport and accommodation for artists hoping to perform - the more money we raise, the more artists we can have at the festival. Not just that warm fuzzy feeling.....Ok ok, so you want something more than just a pat on the back and a good nights sleep knowing you have made a difference.... you want great rewards!There is something for everyone like Postcards from Vanuatu written by WSB actors or Love Patrol DVD's and T-shirts,  even fire breathing or island cooking classes. Yes they're all just a bit of fun but it's the least we can do to say thank you for  your donation. For any donors outside of Vanuatu who might not be visiting anytime soon, don't worry Skype is a wonderful thing so I'm sure we can make something happen for you.It's over to you now!Any donation is greatly appreciated and without it we couldn't pull this off. Of course it doesn't have to be financial, can you provide in country support for the artist? Do you have a spare room at your hotel/guest house that you wouldn't mind donating to a good cause? Can you supply meals for the artists or help us with transport - there is a lot to organise and anything is appreciated. If so please get in touch via email - rhinton@wansmolbag.orgNo pennies to your name?Not a problem, all we ask is that you share, tweet, blog, post and spread the word about what we are doing and how we need help to make it happen. It's hopefully going to be a wonderful festival, don't you want to be able to say that you helped it happen?

story:
Short Summary

My name is Erica Barnes and I am the creator and founder of Lost Geneva Project! The Lost Geneva Project was created to honor my late grandmother Geneva "Jean" Ducar. Geneva was an incredible woman and instilled in all of her daughters and granddaughters a strong feminist sensibility and a do it yourself attitude. To honor her legacy, the Lost Geneva Project will attempt to tell the tales, the myths, and the history of the beloved women of our past and present, one story at a time.

Lost Geneva Project is proud to announce The Penelopiad  by Margaret Atwood will be part of the 2014 Chicago Fringe Festival!

Directed by Erica Barnes
Assistant Director Lexi Saunders
Original Music by Joshua Dumas
Environment and Object Design by Sarah Coleman
Costume Design by Carla Hamilton
Dramaturgy by Sarah Sapperstein

We Need Your Help!

Lost Geneva Project would like to raise $2000 to defray the cost of our production!
 
$675 will cover rights to Atwood's incredible play, The Penelopiad
$200 will costume our incredible cast of 14 WOMEN!
$200 will purchase materials to build the instruments, masks, and other original objects in the Penelopiad world
$125 will defray the cost of rehearsal space rental
$800 will help me offer a small stipend and thank you to the incredibly talented cast and artistic team building The Penelopiad -a 20 person strong ensemble!

Anything beyond $2000 will help me offer a larger stipend to the cast or prepare for any future remounted productions!

    The Play

    I read Margaret Atwood's novella, The Penelopiad, in 2006 and immediately fell in love with the poetry and theatricality inherently present in the novel. I have been ready to have a Penelope stand up, open the novella, and begin reading the story to an audience for eight years! This project is truly my heart song making its way on stage, at last!

    "The Penelopiad', the Play, by Margaret Atwood tells the story of Penelope, the dutiful wife of wily Odysseus, as she reflects on her life and the events of 'The Odyssey' from beyond the grave. Throughout her rumination, the spirits of her twelve maids, who were put to death upon Odysseus' return, interrupt her lengthy monologue with interstitial choral performances and cheeky observations on Penelope's version of the story.

    Support

    Can't Donate? No worries!  Get excited about The Penelopiad  and share the link with friends!
    Can't wait to see it? Come see the The Penelopiad  at the Chicago Fringe Festival. Details at chicagofringe.org
    Know of a theater company or university that might want to produce The Penelopiad after the fringe? Contact Erica Barnes to see where Lost Geneva Project will be next! lostgenevaproject@gmail.com

story:
Ahoy Everyone! I'm Carmel, creative producer of Spectacle & Mirth, the house that brings you such madness as the Teacup Cabaret, The Marvelous Mechanical Music Maiden, and the Shenandoah Fringe Festival. 

Many of us, the diverse performers and patrons of the central Shenandoah Valley, need a reliable place to rehearse and perform year round.  I believe we can continue to fill the niche for small scale theatrics, vaudeville, and collaborative performance by sharing the resource of a venue and raise all boats. And, more than that, we can create a space for embracing our differences as strengths, cross pollinating our creative cultures, and create a more just and equitable community. 

That space, dubbed The Kettle, needs an assist launching its first year. It needs solid funds in order to subsidize some of the concrete costs of the venue (rent, insurance, lighting equipment, etc) until it becomes self sustaining. We are not content with angel investors. We want a grass roots, flip tables, holler-at-the-top-of-your-lungs-'cus-you-want-it congregation! Without it, The Kettle will not be. 


What We Need & What You Get

  • We need at least $5K to subsidize the rent our first year. More than that is great! We have the generous support of a local business for a space with extremely low $/square foot, but every bit adds up. 
  • Any additional funds will go towards other operating needs like, insurance, purchasing a modular lighting and sound system, paying royalties to BMI and ASCAP, etc.
  • There are perks! You can choose to support with a lump sum here on IndieGoGo OR monthly sustaining support over on Patreon and get stuff like tickets to ShenFringe, your name painted on the wall of the space, and private tea parties with Spectacle & Mirth.


Risks & Challenges

If we cannot make this minimum or we don't have enough Collaborators sign on to use the space it won't happen. And thats ok. It will mean that this isn't the right time and possibly not the right place. The Kettle is not meant to be a vanity project for Spectacle & Mirth- if the community doesn't need it or can't support it that is fine. I firmly believe, however, that it deserves a fighting chance to live for at least one glorious year.


Other Ways You Can Help

Share! Share! Share!

But also, become a Collaborator. If this is a resource you've been needing we would love to see you! Here is a very brief googleform you can fill out to tell us your interest or ask questions. You can also reach Carmel at SpectacleAndMirth@gmail.com if you have questions.

Photo courtesy Pat Jarrett

story:
just the lads, a newly formed theatre company based in Dublin, are looking for your help in funding their debut project,The Last Post, which will run as part of this years’ Dublin Fringe Festival.

An old firestation will be transformed into an imagined post office in this show about lost letters and postmen, our unsung heroes. Exploring the changing face of post and communication in Ireland, The Last Post fuses fact, fanciful fiction and personal histories pieced together from interviews, chats and chance encounters with post workers and letters that we’ve picked up and digged out along the way.

€2200 is a lot of money. Lord knows it is, but we plan to use every cent of it, down to the very last 60 cent on a stamp. This funding campaign is to help towards the publicity costs, as well as the rental costs and design of our performance space, The Mart in Rathmines. For us, the small things are just as important as the big ones and we are extremely excited to be working in this amazing building that has been lovingly restored by its new owners. Spanning across three floors, the design is intricate in detail and ambitious in scale, so any help towards funding this element of the show is greatly appreciated!

We want to thank you for helping us, as you can see down the right-hand side of the page there, but even for considering helping us. So, as a reward for being a trooper and getting this far, here’s a little taster of what we’re working with.

 

She said, “read it out Tommy, ah Tom read it out I won’t be shocked.”

 

So Tommy, who was the local postman at the time, said that the headline reads “they’re after introducing Artificial Insemination into humans.”

 

And she said, “Ah Tommy wasn’t the old way so nice.”

 

THIS is the kind of thing we think deserves to be brought to life. Someday soon, that feeling you get when you have a conversation with your postman or get a letter that’s not a bill or a fine won’t bubble up anymore. When was the last time you felt it?

 

Who is involved

The work will be created by just the lads co-founders, Darren Sinnott, Erica Murray and Liadain Kaminska, with a creative team including choreographer Rachel Burke and composer/musician Anna Clifford. Our brilliant cast includes Eimear O Riordan, Peter Corboy, Darren Yorke and Joan Somers Donnelly.

About the Company

just the lads was established in 2012 by Darren Sinnott, Erica Murray and Liadain Kaminska, with the aim to create original theatre from

  • in depth conversations

  • playful interaction

  • everyday life and occupations

In The Last Post we ask, are the last generation of letter writers? We want celebrate what has come before, and explore what lies ahead, but most of all grab an armful of letters and take our audience on an adventure through an imagined world of post.

story:
Breve reseña

Tras siete años trabajando en la cultura puertorriqueña con montajes como CONSTRUYENDO A VERÓNICA, El Método Grönholm, Mercado libre o La Cocina, nuestra entidad sin fines de lucro TANTAI TEATRO PR acaba de ser invitada a formar parte del 2014 LATC Encuentro: A National Latina/o Theatre Festival con nuestra última producción AGUA A CUCHARADAS.

Catorce miembros del equipo (elenco, regidora, producción, utileria y vestuario, técnico de video mapping, entre otros) representaremos con nuestro trabajo al teatro puertorriqueño con este texto de Quiara Alegría Hudes, premio Pulitzer 2012.

Debido a la importancia de este Festival Encuentro, todos los artistas viajarán a Los Ángeles entre el 20 de octubre y el 10 de noviembre para presentar la pieza en Los Ángeles Theatre Center (www.thelatc.org) de forma altruista. Como embajadores de Puerto Rico y del teatro latino nacional, no sólo presentaremos la pieza, sino que formaremos parte de este foro junto a doce de las más prestigiosas compañías de Estados Unidos para crear juntos y establecer lazos culturales con la comunidad artística latina.


Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Aunque ya de por sí la invitación es un honor y no cobraremos por nuestro trabajo, para lograr esta misión necesitamos cubrir ciertos gastos.

El Festival Encuentro provee transportación y hospedaje para los catorce miembros del equipo. Sin embargo, necesitamos sufragar la construcción de algunas piezas de escenografía, el alquiler de proyector de Video Mapping (recurso innovador que es elemento básico en nuestro montaje), gastos de dietas, entre otros.

Aún no hemos logrado ayuda institucional, por lo que creemos que el crowdfunding y el auspicio privado es la mejor manera de poder realizar este trabajo y representar la cultura nacional con un nivel de excelencia.

Con tu ayuda, vamos a lograr demostrar que la cultura puertorriqueña tiene un tiene su espacio en la esfera teatral mundial, como se reconoció a nivel internacional cuando Quiara Alegría Hudes (también nominada al Tony por el libreto del reconocido músical In The Heighs) obtuvo el prestigioso Pulitzer.

Además, Tantai te obsequiará con varias recompensas por tu ayuda. ¡No te vas a arrepentir!

    El impacto

    La trayectoria de trabajo de Tantai ha demostrado que se puede tener éxito con productos culturales de alta calidad que aporten al panorama artístico en Puerto Rico. Ahora es el momento de exportar esa representación y demostrar que nuestra Isla tiene un alto valor por la cultura. ¡Ayúdanos a demostrarlo!


      Riesgos y desafíos

      En el camino a Los Ángeles, muchos gastos pueden surgir de improvisto. Tenemos que transportar utilería y vestuario, construir piezas de la escenografía, alquilar equipo... Necesitamos estar cubiertos económicamente ante los riesgos que nuestra producción pueda enfrentar para no desmerecer la calidad de nuestro trabajo. Estamos dispuestos a llevar nuestro arte de manera gratuita, pero... ¡te necesitamos para que sea viable!


        Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

        Cualquier aportación es valida, por pequeña que sea. Cada granito cuenta y te lo agradeceremos desde lo más profundo de nuestro corazón. Aún así, si no puedes ayudarnos económicamente, también puedes:

        • proponernos alternativas de agencias que creas que puedan auspiciarnos, escribir a entidades públicas hablándoles de la calidad de nuestro trabajo y solicitando que aporten para esta exportación cultural. ¡Comparte tu capital social con nosotros!
        • comparte nuestra solicitud de ayuda. Si tú no puedes aportar dinero, tal vez otros puedan.

        Te lo agradeceremos de verdad.

story: Would you like to be a patron for Starrs Mill High School's production of The Addams Family? Well this is your chance! My name is Sydney Johnson and I am a senior and an actress at Starrs Mill High School. This year, we are putting on the creepy, eerie, comedic show, The Addams Family! Starrs Mill is known for their amazing and luxurious theater program. The school was nominated for Best Choreography at this years Shuler Hensley Awards in Atlanta, Georgia for their production of Shrek . If you come see the show, you'll be blown away and amazed by the magnificent set pieces, costumes, choreography, and large amount of talent that Starrs Mill High has to offer. Be a patron for this great cause! Every cast member is encouraged to gather money. Any amount is greatly appreciated not only by me, but by everyone involved with the show! If you contribute, your name will appear in the program listed as an extended member of the Addams Family!

story:
The hilarious and singular new play DEBUTANTE is back and getting its world premiere production! Following its sold-out performance at Ars Nova, there’s no better place to bring one of ANT Fest’s most talked about shows than to the beautiful Bernie Wohl Theater. Thanks to a generous donation from the Goddard Riverside Center, one of New York's leading human service organizations, we'll be taking up residence this spring amidst some of Manhattan’s great cultural institutions and bringing the best of the downtown theatre scene to life uptown.

DEBUTANTE. follows the preparations and ultimate debut of a group of restless young heiresses living in decadence during a worldwide financial crisis. Through late night bike rides, TAB soda overdoses and Jazzercise sessions inspired by the soap opera "Dynasty", these poor little rich girls come of age as they come out to the world.

Inspired by real life debutantes Barbara Hutton and and Brenda Frazier, we're chomping at the bit to bring this unusual coming of age story about and by women into the world.

Getting to our first performance on April 23rd is no small task.

This is where we need you.

The creative team is deep in preparation to bring DEBUTANTE. and Ms. Peasgood’s “coming out" class back to the Big Apple. We have assembled a tremendous team of actors and designers to make this production a rousing success. But we can't move forward without your generous support.

Your donation will get this play off the page and into our beautiful performance space, enabling us to pay for:

Marketing and Publicity to help bring in an audience.

Set, Costumes, Props, Lights to make this show look fantastic.

Stipends for our artists and designers to pay for their time and hard work.

While $5000 isn't the entire amount we hope to raise, it will ensure that we get to April 23rd with all of the necessary elements in place.

Every dollar donated is an investment in the vibrant arts community of the Upper West Side, in the incredible community engagement work the Goddard Riverside Center has been doing for over 50 years and, even more, in the next generation of performers, writers and directors so that they can make electrifying and relevant theater.

First and foremost, we're looking for financial contributions. Each level of donation gives you exclusive access to the production and our performances this spring.

Can’t make a financial donation? Telling even one friend about our campaign is a huge help to our upcoming production. Use the links below! 

Performance of DEBUTANTE. will take place Wednesday through Saturday between April 23 and May 10. 

All performances begin at 8pm. 

Tickets are now on sale at http://debutante.brownpapertickets.com

ANNIE TIPPE (director/creator) - Annie is a New York-based director and performer. She was the Associate Director for the TEAM's production of Mission Drift, which recently toured Australia and Hong Kong (dir. Rachel Chavkin). Directing credits include Aaron/Marie (Under the Radar Incoming Series at the Public; Prelude Festival '13; Ars Nova’s ANT Fest), Dinosaur Play (HERE Arts), The Collected Rules of Gifted Camp (The Brick), First Ladies Project (E. 4th Street Theater). Williamstown Theater Directing Intern 2012. 

RYANN WEIR (writer) - Ryann Weir is an actor/playwright based in New York. Her work has been performed at Ars Nova, HERE Arts Center, NYU, NYTW's E. 4th St.Theater, The Second City's Donny Skybox, The Pit ,Theater for the New City as part of The Dream Up Festival, The Cookery Festival at Playwrights Horizons Theater School, and Fresh Ground Pepper. Ryann is a member of Smith + Tinker, a collaborative writers' group at HERE Arts Center. She was also chosen as a playwright for FGP's inaugural writers retreat in 2013. Ryann holds a BFA in Drama from NYU's Tisch School of the Arts.

ROBB NANUS (producer) - Robb is a New York based producer. He recently co- produced Andrew Lippa’s I AM HARVEY MILK with Bruce Cohen (Silver Linings Playbook, Milk) this past June with the San Francisco Gay Men’s Chorus and will be bringing it to New York in the fall of 2014. Other NY projects: Wild Party Swings: Andrew Lippa meets Charlie Rosen's Broadway Big Band (54 Below), Bus Stop (Rattlestick Playwrights Theater's Middle Voice Theatre Company), Motherline (NY Fringe Festival). Robb has worked in various capacities with the National Alliance for Musical Theater, the TONY Award winning Signature Theatre in DC, The Music Theatre Company in Chicago, Telsey + Co, and Turbovote.


Special thanks to Caitlin Machak, Ryan Toussieng & Gianmarco Soresi with their help in putting this campaign together.

Photos by Bailey Carr. Baileycarr.com

story:
Calling All Art Lovers: Lux Boreal Dance Company seeks your help in funding an incredibly important event that supports emerging choreographers. This is the fifth conference Lux has produced since 2009 and we are happy to report the conference’s expansion in interest and attendance from young artists spanning North and Central America.

Lux Boreal is delighted to witness the continued growth of the conference of emerging choreographers and provide the newest generation of dance artists the opportunity to network and share their creations with the public of Tijuana, Mexico. In addition to such success, we are also challenged with the raising costs necessary to produce such a beneficial and educational event. Lux’s conferences promote not only the Northwest dance scene of Mexico, but also the display of unique point of views in contemporary dance from different parts of the world.

5th Conference of Emerging Choreographers, Tijuana in Movement 2014:

Lux Boreal Dance Company in conjunction with the Municipal Institute Of Art and Culture (IMAC) of Tijuana presents the 5th Conference of Emerging Choreographers, Tijuana in Movement 2014 as an effort to encourage the enhancement and development of new generations of choreographers and artists seeking to join the professional dance scene. 

The conference's main objective is to serve as a platform for the display of fresh dance proposals. Operating as such a unique event, young choreographers and artists alike, from various regions of Mexico, the United States, and South America will have the opportunity to connect with other members of the professional dance scene. These connections and networks will thereby help generate and foster a genuinely diverse and international cultural conversation. 

The 5th Conference of Emerging Choreographers, Tijuana in Movement 2014 runs from July 30th to August 2nd, 2014 in the city of Tijuana, Baja California at the rehearsal space and traditional theater of Tijuana's House of Culture, as well as specific urban sites within the city to provide an alternative performance space to spur insight.


Thanks to IMAC, Mexico en Escena, Conaculta, Fonca, and the House of Culture of Tijuana Lux has already covered the costs of renting the theater and its technicians, payment to the staff during the conference, renting of the dance space for the workshops, and site-specific performances.


We are asking for your help to cover the following costs:

  • 3-day/3-night hotel and food accommodations for the 16 accepted artists.
  • Payments to the invited teachers of our four separate dance workshops.

All choreographers and dancers attending from outside of Tijuana (Oaxaca [Mexico], San Luis Potosí, Mazatlan, Mexico City, New York City [USA], and Bogotá [Columbia]) are responsible for their own transportation to and from the convention. We do not believe it is fair to ask the participants to add the extra cost of food and lodging while they are in attendance. Hence, we are inquiring about your ability to help us relieve this cost.


What we offer in return:

  • Recognition within the social network and our Newsletter.
  • Recognition within the program of the conference.
  • Recognition within our website at www.luxboreal.org
  • Complimentary entry into the performances of the conference.
  • Complimentary entry into another Lux Boreal performance.
  • A free T-shirt from the even which we give to all of the participants.
  • And of course our sincerest most heart felt gratitude!


Agenda of activities:

The Conference will occur from July 30th until August 2nd, 2014

July 30th, 2014  Arrival of the artists

July 31st, 2014  Room 104 of Tijauna’s House of Culture

          First Master Class: 9:00am – 10:30am

          Second Master Class: 10:30am – 12:00pm

          Rehearsal for the participants: 12:00pm – 6:00 pm

 July 31st, 2014  Theater at Tijuana’s House of Culture

          Technical Rehearsals: 10:00am – 6:00pm

          General Rehearsal: 6:00pm – 7:30pm

          Performance: 8:00pm – 9:30pm

August 1st, 2014  Rooms 104 of Tijuana’s House of Culture

          Third Master Class: 9:00am – 10:30am

          Fourth Master Class: 10:30am – 12:00pm

 

August 1st, 2014  Alternative spaces at Playas de Tijuana’s House of Culture

          Site-Specific Choreography 1:00pm – 7:00pm

          Site Specific Performance: 8:00 pm – 9:00 pm

August 2nd, 2014 Audiovisual Room in the Palace of Culture 11:30am – 2:00pm

          Open Table Discussion with invited dance critic.

August 2nd, 2014 Palace of Culture’s Patio: 2:00pm – 4:00pm

          Official lunch to end the Conference

August 2nd, 2014    Departure of the artists

*This document was edited by Allison Spivack*

                                                                                                                                         

La Compañía de Danza Lux Boreal solicita su apoyo para financiar un encuentro jóvenes artistas y bailarines que se realiza en la ciudad de Tijuana. Este es la quinta edición de este evento que Lux Boreal produce desde el 2009 y nos sentimos orgullosos de comunicar que cada año ha continuado expandiéndose, atrayendo a jóvenes artistas desde América del Norte hasta Sudamérica. 

Para la compañía de danza Lux Boreal ha sido un logro importante el crecimiento del Encuentro de Jóvenes Creadores, el cual representa una plataforma para las nuevas generaciones de artistas, donde se brinda la exposición, la visibilidad, la crítica y la retroalimentación, así como compartir sus creaciones con el público del área Tijuana, México.

Sin embargo, en este 2014, la organización del Encuentro enfrenta un déficit presupuestal con el aumento los costos para producirlo. Este año, la programación busca proyectar no solo la escena de la danza del noroeste de México, sino también la exhibición de interesantes puntos de vista de danza contemporánea de diferentes partes del mundo.

V Encuentro de Jóvenes Creadores Tijuana en Movimiento 2014:

Con el objetivo de motivar el desarrollo de las nuevas generaciones de creadores y artistas en formación que busquen incorporarse a la escena de la danza profesional, Lux Boreal en conjunto con el Instituto de Cultura de Baja California, convocan al V Encuentro de Jóvenes Creadores, Tijuana en Movimiento 2014.

Este encuentro tiene como principal objetivo, instalarse como un sólido foro para la exhibición de propuestas dancísticas frescas, donde jóvenes de México, Estados Unidos y Sudamérica los lleve a coincidir en la escena dancística, propiciando así una genuina diversidad del diálogo escénico.

El V Encuentro de Jóvenes Creadores, Tijuana Danza 2014, se realizará los días 30, 31 de julio, 1 y 2 de agosto del 2014 en la ciudad de Tijuana, Baja California y tendrá como espacio escénico el Teatro de la Casa de la Cultura de Tijuana así como sedes de intervención en Casa de Cultura de Playas.


Lo Que Necesitamos/ Lo Que Recibes

Gracias a Instituto Municipal de Arte y Cultura, México en Escena, Consejo Nacional para la Cultura y las Artes de México y la Casa De la Cultura de Tijuana, Lux Boreal ya ha cubierto los costos de alquiler del teatro para la noche de gala de danza y sus técnicos, pago al personal durante el Encuentro, alquiler del estudio para los talleres, conferencia y para el programa de intervenciones dancísticas en sitios específicos.

Estamos pidiendo su ayuda cubrir los gastos siguientes:

  • Hospedaje 3 días/3 noches hotel y comida para los 16 artistas aceptados
  • Honorarios a los profesores invitados de nuestros cuatro talleres de danza 

Todos los coreógrafos y bailarines procedentes de fuera de Tijuana (Oaxaca, San Luis Potosí, Mazatlán Sin., México D.F., Nueva York [Estados Unidos] y Bogotá [Colombia]) son responsables de su propio transporte llegar y salir del Encuentro. El Evento organizador se hace cargo de dichos costos comida de y alojamiento mientras los participantes están presentes. Por este motivo es que nos acercamos a usted para ayudarnos a aliviar este costo.

Qué ofrecemos a cambio:

  • Reconocimiento por la red y nuestro Newsletter.
  • Reconocimiento dentro del programa del Encuentro.
  • Reconocimiento dentro de nuestro sitio web en www.luxboreal.org
  • Entrada gratuita en las actuaciones del V Encuentro de Jóvenes Creadores
  • Entrada gratis en una función de la Compañía de Danza Lux Boreal, incluyendo el próximo estreno.

  • Una camiseta diseño especial del V Encentro de Jóvenes Creadores.

  • Y por supuesto nuestra más sincera gratitud por su apoyo al desarrollo del arte.

story:
The Drumf and the Rhinegold

‘The Drumf and the Rhinegold’ promises to be a New York City Event. The exceedingly short opera is the centerpiece of an immersive installation offering audiences a window into the decadence and absurdity of Trump’s world against the backdrop of a 7,000 sq.ft. condemned space in a Manhattan tower. Told entirely from the perspectives of Ivana, Marla and Melania, the story doesn’t allow Drumf a word in edgewise. Honestly, he doesn’t deserve one. The farce culminates with a not-to-be-missed Drumf take-down in a swimming pool. 

This project brings together top tier NYC artists, including director Doug Fitch (New York Phil), Claire Chase (MacArthur Genius 2012), Peter Savieri (The Muppets) and composer Matti Kovler (Floating Tower). We have 27 people participating in the production, all have graciously volunteered their time, but we still need to cover our production costs. With only $5000, we're confident we can make this show so visually spectacular that it outshines Trump Tower. Any funds raised beyond our goal will go towards the artists for their work. 

Here's where your money is going. . . 

  • $500 Drumf's Hair - Optic fiber filaments. Marabou feather and silk thread. Foam rubber. (So Trump gets his signature look and his hair can fly. Yup. Fly.)
  • $200 Drumf's Costume - Facial prosthetics. Body paint. Artificial sea weed and foliage. (So Trump will stay stylish even while his empire crumbles)
  • $200 Drumf's Bed - Wood and construction materials. Gold fabric and accents. Sheet plastic. Gold colored embellishments. A lot of gold spray paint. (So Trump can sleep on the job)
  • $400 Spa - Silver mylar sheeting. "Gold" statue for fountain. Artificial flowers painted gold. (So Trump can relax. Not)
  • $200 Pool - Gold tarp over shallow pool structure. Wood and construction materials. (So Trump can cool down after we light a fire under his ass)
  • $300 Vortex to the Rhine - Synthetic hollofil material for clouds. Black and gray spray paint. Wood and construction materials for arches. (So Trump can be sucked into a different universe where we don’t have to deal with him anymore)
  • $600 Rhinemaidens Tails - Satin. Foam backing. Embroidery cord. Rhinestone embellishments. Artificial flowers and foliage. Carbon fiber poles to operate tails. (So Trump can be defeated by realistic looking mermaids)
  • $300 Ivana's Hair, Marla's Hair, Melania's Hair - Blond lace front wig with a high percentage of human hair, temporary hair-chalk (So Trump’s vanquishers look fly as hell)
  • $1300 Lights - lighting desk and stage lights (So Trump’s downfall is very easy to see)
  • $400 - Venue Staff and Security
  • $500 - Bar set up, chairs for audience members, bits and bobs (So the architects of Trump’s demise can watch him go down in comfort)

 

Impact

‘The Drumf and the Rhinegold' is a small production with a huge impact. The tactics and statements of the Trump 2016 campaign have shocked and outraged us. As artists, we have chosen to respond by creating a piece that reduces Trump to what he really is: a greedy, power-hungry dwarf. Being a part of this project means that you are contributing to the destruction of a presidential campaign that has attempted to incite hatred and violence among Americans. Don’t stand by and do nothing as Trump continues to peddle his agenda of lies, misogyny and racism. 

 

Can’t contribute? There are still so many ways you can help this production. 

Share the event on social media: this has the potential to be the talk of the town, so help us generate buzz (https://www.facebook.com/events/1118804544822777/). 

Send this Indiegogo campaign to anyone you think would be interested and wants to end Trump’s tirade once and for all

Show up to one of the performances on Oct 30th or 31st 2016 (http://www.thedrumf.com/tickets/)

Help us end hatred. With mermaids. 

 

(Floating Tower operates under the fiscal sponsorship of the Centre for Jewish Creativity, a registered 501(c3). If you wish to make a tax deductible donation, please contact erin@floatingtower.com)
story_txt:
The Drumf and the Rhinegold‘The Drumf and the Rhinegold’ promises to be a New York City Event. The exceedingly short opera is the centerpiece of an immersive installation offering audiences a window into the decadence and absurdity of Trump’s world against the backdrop of a 7,000 sq.ft. condemned space in a Manhattan tower. Told entirely from the perspectives of Ivana, Marla and Melania, the story doesn’t allow Drumf a word in edgewise. Honestly, he doesn’t deserve one. The farce culminates with a not-to-be-missed Drumf take-down in a swimming pool. This project brings together top tier NYC artists, including director Doug Fitch (New York Phil), Claire Chase (MacArthur Genius 2012), Peter Savieri (The Muppets) and composer Matti Kovler (Floating Tower). We have 27 people participating in the production, all have graciously volunteered their time, but we still need to cover our production costs. With only $5000, we're confident we can make this show so visually spectacular that it outshines Trump Tower. Any funds raised beyond our goal will go towards the artists for their work. Here's where your money is going. . . 
$500 Drumf's Hair - Optic fiber filaments. Marabou feather and silk thread. Foam rubber. (So Trump gets his signature look and his hair can fly. Yup. Fly.)
$200 Drumf's Costume - Facial prosthetics. Body paint. Artificial sea weed and foliage. (So Trump will stay stylish even while his empire crumbles)
$200 Drumf's Bed - Wood and construction materials. Gold fabric and accents. Sheet plastic. Gold colored embellishments. A lot of gold spray paint. (So Trump can sleep on the job)
$400 Spa - Silver mylar sheeting. "Gold" statue for fountain. Artificial flowers painted gold. (So Trump can relax. Not)
$200 Pool - Gold tarp over shallow pool structure. Wood and construction materials. (So Trump can cool down after we light a fire under his ass)
$300 Vortex to the Rhine - Synthetic hollofil material for clouds. Black and gray spray paint. Wood and construction materials for arches. (So Trump can be sucked into a different universe where we don’t have to deal with him anymore)
$600 Rhinemaidens Tails - Satin. Foam backing. Embroidery cord. Rhinestone embellishments. Artificial flowers and foliage. Carbon fiber poles to operate tails. (So Trump can be defeated by realistic looking mermaids)
$300 Ivana's Hair, Marla's Hair, Melania's Hair - Blond lace front wig with a high percentage of human hair, temporary hair-chalk (So Trump’s vanquishers look fly as hell)
$1300 Lights - lighting desk and stage lights (So Trump’s downfall is very easy to see)
$400 - Venue Staff and Security
$500 - Bar set up, chairs for audience members, bits and bobs (So the architects of Trump’s demise can watch him go down in comfort)
 Impact‘The Drumf and the Rhinegold' is a small production with a huge impact. The tactics and statements of the Trump 2016 campaign have shocked and outraged us. As artists, we have chosen to respond by creating a piece that reduces Trump to what he really is: a greedy, power-hungry dwarf. Being a part of this project means that you are contributing to the destruction of a presidential campaign that has attempted to incite hatred and violence among Americans. Don’t stand by and do nothing as Trump continues to peddle his agenda of lies, misogyny and racism.  Can’t contribute? There are still so many ways you can help this production. Share the event on social media: this has the potential to be the talk of the town, so help us generate buzz (https://www.facebook.com/events/1118804544822777/). Send this Indiegogo campaign to anyone you think would be interested and wants to end Trump’s tirade once and for allShow up to one of the performances on Oct 30th or 31st 2016 (http://www.thedrumf.com/tickets/)Help us end hatred. With mermaids.  (Floating Tower operates under the fiscal sponsorship of the Centre for Jewish Creativity, a registered 501(c3). If you wish to make a tax deductible donation, please contact erin@floatingtower.com)

story:
Free 2 Be Me Dance is an adaptive dance program founded by Colleen Perry 6 years ago with the belief that ballet is the perfect conduit to contribute to the lives of children with Down syndrome by empowering them through the joy and challenge of dance while at the same time increasing their self-worth through social connections and opportunities to perform in front of live audiences.

Our extraordinary dancers have been amusing and enchanting local audiences and now our biggest dream has come true! We have just been selected to perform to a world wide audience at the 2015 SPECIAL OLYMPICS WORLD GAMES.  The World Games, which takes place only every 4 years, happens to be in Los Angeles this summer. Our dancers come from a wide range of cultural and socio-economic backgrounds, but we have prided ourselves on raising funds only when necessary.  It is for this reason we are asking you to contribute to our campaign with as little or as much as feels comfortable to you.  We are in serious need of funding to cover the expenses that come along with this once in a lifetime opportunity.

Your donation will help cover the costs of costumes, uniforms, studio rental and transportation for 24 dancers so they can be prepared to shine in front of a world wide audience.

story:
Synopsis:

Little Shop of Horrors is a musical written by Howard Ashman and Alan Menken about a down and out Skid Row florist who is madly in love with his co-worker Audrey. Audrey is unfortunately in an abuse relationship with Orin, a sadistic dentist. Mushnik, the owner of the shop is desperate for money and Seymour is desperate to get out of there. So Seymour buys a man-eating plant - Audrey II, who ends up taking over the world.

I am directing this show for Newcastle University Theatre Society, one of the largest and most successful student theatre societies in the United Kingdom. As a student society we are not given a large budget by the University. Therefore, we urge as many people as possible to donate to make this show fantastic. The money is being raised to rent a set of the large Audrey II puppets.

Little Shop of Horrors holds a very special place in my heart as it is one of the first productions I was ever involved in as a child and cemented my love of theatre. This is my first experience directing a musical and it has been amazing so far and we want the show to showcase the hard-work and talent of the cast and crew.

The Team:

Chloe Simpson: Director. Third Year English Literature Student.

Eve Kershaw: Producer. Third Year Fine Art Student.

Tom Edney: Musical Director. Second Year Music Student.

story:
What is so good about Scene + Heard?

Smock Allies : Scene + Heard is a festival of new work across all live performance genres : MUSIC – DANCE – THEATRE – COMEDY - SPOKEN WORD. 

Why is it unique? 

It provides a risk free environment for artists to meet, collaborate and stage a bold new IDEA in front of a live audience, who in turn play advocate and share their opinions on what they've just seen. Tickets are sold at low prices. Audiences get to see multiple ideas per ticket.

Sometimes there is aerial vaudeville. Occasionally there is documentary pop-opera.

But there is never the same thing twice.

The programme is always fresh, bold, funny and exciting.

Tales of Tech, Hostage Situations, Comedy Brunch, Live Radio Broadcast are some of the ideas that will feature in our 2018 programme which launches on JAN 10.

Our team of people have gathered years of experience producing arts + music festivals, theatre, TV + film, graphic design, architecture, photography, music, marketing, dramaturgy and dance. We have our own team of innovative technical folk and a wonderful team of GENERATORS from our Production Manager training programme. 

What We Need to give to our Artists

Lettuce break it down for you in some more detail...

This year we have over 109 individual companies bringing their creative energies and taking part in our 2018 programme!

We provide Dramaturgy, Production support, Producers Workshops and Marketing + Sales techniques to help the maker reach the widest audience possible

We need funds to hire a theatre for 3 x weeks (€12,000), provide lighting operators and equipment(€6,500) as well as print copies of the colourful festival programme (€1,000) so that our audience know what wonderful work the artists are presenting in 2018

The Impact of the Arts on our Community

On an international stage, Ireland's culture is held up as vibrant, diverse, valued and valuable. On a personal level, you may value hugely a particular genre such as Opera or Irish Dancing.

The NUMBERS speak for themselves

65% of Adults attend arts events in Ireland* 

In schools, the arts promote tolerance, accelerate learning and build confidence.

In hospitals and healthcare settings, the arts create opportunities for people who face long-term illness and treatment to be creative, joyful, and strong,  and in areas where people are marginalised, the arts can help them find their voice, to be empowered, heard and understood.

The arts give perspective and insights and fight prejudices such as xenophobia and homophobia by providing insight into the lives of others.

The arts describe in a unique way our sense of identity, community and belonging and thereby provide a vital “glue” for social cohesion, a clear societal benefit.

Also it's damn entertaining.

Risks + Challenges

Over the last few difficult years, though the arts have proved their resilience, popularity and value, they have borne harsh economic circumstances and need to find ways to adapt in order to survive. We are asking you to support the long term sustainability of the arts by supporting NEW WORK and the emerging artists and donating to Scene + Heard 2018. 

Other Ways You Can Help

COME to the festival, PARTICIPATE by giving your feedback to the Artists.

You can REVIEW in a myriad of ways (secret ballot, video booth, tablet survey, Q&A, live twitter feed, candy poll) which is sent directly to the artists.

Follow @smockalley on Twitter

Like our page on Facebook  

Or to find out more about discounts and deals by signing up to our Mailing List

Alternatively you can support the Artists + Irish Art by liking and sharing news of their work through your own social media platforms :)

story:
Short Summary

Middle Ground Theatre is a collective based in Albuquerque, New Mexico. We are comprised of current and former students from the University of New Mexico.

This campaign is to help us put up our second production, Stop Kiss by Diana Son. This show is important to us because we want to start conversations in the Albuquerque community about topics such as interracial relationships, bisexuality, and misogyny.

By contributing to this campaign, you will help us put up a show that is about more than entertainment. It's about relationships and identity. With Stop Kiss, we hope to open a dialogue spanning across generational lines, something that we can talk about no matter our class or race.

 

What We Need & What You Get

In total, we need $900. All funding will go towards getting this show up and running in January 2018. This includes costumes, makeup, performance space, marketing, furniture, set pieces, and props. Additionally, if we reach our goal, we'll donate $100 to the Hispanic Federation for disaster relief in Puerto Rico.

Perks include signed goods, social media shout-outs, and reserved seats!

If we don't reach our entire goal, we'll use whatever we have to fund Stop Kiss as best we can. The show must go on!

 

The Impact

This project is valuable because representation matters. Stop Kiss features a diverse cast with two strong woman leads.

Middle Ground Theatre's previous campaign raised $1,000 for our very first show, Gruesome Playground Injuries by Rajiv Joseph. We reached our entire goal and put on 7 performances from August 25 through September 3, 2017

 

Challenges

As a brand new theatre company, we face the challenge of visibility. As we build up our company, we need to get the word out about raising funds for our shows. Since we're all college students, we don't inherently have the money to fully fund ourselves, which is where you come in! Every dollar helps us build awareness in Albuquerque, which will allow us to put on shows in the future

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Tight on money? No problem! You can help us out by spreading the word about Middle Ground Theatre and this campaign. You can follow us on Facebook and Instagram to like, comment, and share our posts. Thanks!

story:
Hi!

Thank you for clicking through to us, and for reading! We are an emerging theatre company in Manchester. And we need your help!

YESYESNONO is one of the most exciting young companies in the UK right now. Our debut show, 'Five Encounters on a Site Called Craigslist' won the Total Theatre Award for Best Emerging Company 2017, and following our second show, '[insert slogan here]' the Guardian included us in their list of the Top Five Best Young Companies of 2018. 

We're making a new show. It's called  'the accident did not take place' and it's about mass media and social media and the effect they have on information and truth. This is a big step up in scale for us, as we introduce multiple performers, new technical equipment, and a series of new engagement and outreach schemes alongside the process. We're making the show with the dedicated support of ARC Centre in Stockton, HOME in Manchester and Camden People's Theatre in London and are touring it through Autumn 2019 and beyond. If we are to achieve this great step up in scale and ambition, we need to raise funds through channels like crowdfunding alongside our Arts Council Grant application.

What We Need 

The engagement work for our new show is split into three strands. We're hoping that if these strands are successful for this project, they will become a regular and crucial feature of our work in the future. We need support from our backers to pay for food for our participants, travel for our participants, and fees for the workshop facilitators. Here's what we've got in store:

Firstly, we'll be hosting Focus Groups and Practical Workshops with young people from colleges local to each of our partner venues. These groups will be focussed on the themes of the show: mass and social media. We want to talk to the people who have grown up with these media as a regular part of their life from early age, and hear what they have to say about those themes. The groups are an opportunity for our show to develop according to the viewpoints of young people with a unique perspective on these media, and for us to avoid patronising tones in our treatment of the material. They are also a chance for young people to discuss and explore these issues in a safe space with their peers, whilst investigating how they work in a fun and practical way. As a company, we will provide food and travel for all participants. 

Secondly, we'll be launching our Open Rehearsal Scheme at each of our partner venues. On certain days within our time at each venue, we will open our rehearsal room to a group of select emerging artists, to come and observe our process. We want this scheme to be a means with which emerging artists can gain new skills, ask any questions they might have, and garner an understanding of the broader process of making a show. As such, we will put aside dedicated time at the end of the rehearsal, so as to allow the participants to offer their thoughts and ask any questions. In this way the scheme offers us avenues with which we can develop our own practise, as well as that of artists around us. As a company, we will provide all travel costs for the participants to these schemes.

Thirdly, we'll be opening our weekly Sharings to all participants from the Focus Groups and Open Rehearsal Scheme, as well as other young artists we think would enjoy the opportunity to see work in development. Not only does this provide us with a broad range of critical angles with which to develop our process and our work, but it also offers young artists and college students to see work in development, and to see how a process manifests at various stages in the journey of a show. 

The Impact

All of these schemes are part of our broader desire to open our work up to audiences and to artists. We want to bring the viewpoints, opinions and ideas of the people who we make work about, whilst offering up our process and our ideas to them at every stage of a show's journey. 

As individual artists, Sam and Rhian have organised, facilitated and managed engagement schemes for a long time, and across multiple demographics. This represents an opportunity to fold that experience into the process and philosophy of YESYESNONO and our work.

To make these schemes successful, and to bring in the people we want to bring in, we need to be able to provide travel and food. This is a crucial part of the budget that we are asking for support with. We also need to provide facilitator fees for the Focus Groups and Practical Workshops, to ensure that we are maximising what we get and what we offer from that time. This is a crucial part of the budget for which we are asking for your support.

Perks and Other Ways You Can Help

Take a look at the bar at the side for the great rewards on offer for our backers. If you have any questions about any of them, don't hesitate to get in touch!

If you can't donate then that's absolutely fine. But if you want to support YESYESNONO and think that we're doing sounds exciting, then you can help us out by sharing this link to other people. Getting the word out is just as good!

Thank you all, and we'll see you all soon!

Sam and Rhian
