story:
Who We Are

Jazz Roots Dance was formed in 2009 by the world-renowned jazz choreographer, Sue Samuels. The company is dedicated to the preservation of the classical jazz form,and aims to entertain and educate people from all generations about the roots of jazz dance.

About This Project

We´re asking you to support us in presenting works from our repertory, a total weekend of Jazz Roots Dance. First Season Performances with Gala Reception April 27th and 28th 2013 at Salvatore Capezio Theater in New York City. We will be donating tickets to local organizations, providing more access to the community. 

About Our Campaign

We are a professional company and are always seeking new performance opportunities to excite our audiences about classic Jazz Dance and educate them about its rich history. As a relatively new company, we need to think of innovative ways to meet our substantial performance costs.  The $5,000 we are looking to raise from this campaign will help us to present our first Season Performances, which will raise the profile of Jazz Roots Dance and help us to expand the work we feel so passionate about. Specifically, the money raised will go towards;

  • Dancers
  • Theater and rehearsal space rental
  • Technical Support - Lighting and Sound, Stage Manager
  • Photography and Videography
  • Advertising / Marketing: flyers, playbills, website, design, publicity
  • Liability Insurance
  • Costumes
  • Production / Administrative Support
  • Ticket donations to the local community


Our Reviews

This is what you will be supporting when you contribute to our campaign.

            “....a Broadway-esque expression of showy movements linked by rhythm and punctuated by individual pizzazz.  Various styles seamlessly flow through the choreography, held together by music, strong lines and performance – a testament to the potential of classical jazz.”    Brian McCormick, Dance Studio Life

Our work has also been described as,

             “...sultry, witty, dynamic, sentimental, popular, energizing, sensual” Milly Rockefeller, Martha Graham Dancer.

Other Ways you Can Help

Please spread the word about Jazz Roots Dance Company. 

Connect with us on Facebook and Twitter

Come and see us perform - go to our website to find out how you can be involved in the latest Jazz Roots happenings.

http://www.jazzrootsdance.com/

story:
Who We Are

Costly Desires is the brain-child of local artist Megan Becker. She has assembled a team of local artists to produce an original multi-media piece that addresses the industry of human trafficking.

Megan has assembled a group of passionate and talented artists she met while living, working and doing theatre in NYC and Seattle, all of whom are troubled by the scourge of modern-day slavery that is happening right here, in our backyard, perpetrated by our own US Citizens. While volunteering with local organizations who battle this issue every day, this group has become increasingly burdened by the issue of human sex trafficking, especially once they learned that Seattle was the #3 City for trafficking minors, behind only NYC and Las Vegas.

Being theatre and arts veterans, they wanted to raise awareness of this issue the best way they knew how: creatively and artistically. It is their hope this piece will give voice to the thousands of young women out there who are forced into prostitution, provide support for the unsung heroes on the front lines of combatting this atrocity, and move others to get involved.

What We Need & What You Get

Although we've received a tremendous amount of support and in-kind donations, it costs money to produce anything theatrically. We are raising funds to pay for:

  • Space rental and insurance.
  • Actors and creative team a small stipend to cover transportation costs.
  • Promotional items such as flyers, postcards, and programs.
  • Expenses associated with our fund-raising event.
We've had some wonderful items donated to us to assist with our fundraising efforts. That include gift cards, theatre tickets from Renton Civic Theatre and Tacoma Musical Playhouse, tickets to Pacific NW Ballet, and other wonderful items.

The Impact

All proceeds from this production will go directly to two organizations who are fighting hard, with limited resources, to fight human slavery in Seattle:
  • REST
  • The Genesis Project: http://www.gpseattle.org/?doing_wp_cron=1350361...

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate right now, you can still help! Please tell your friends about this project and spread the word! Help us publicize this event so that we have full houses. Also, we are looking for volunteers both backstage and at the theatre during performances -- ushers, prop masters, house manager -- if you are willing, we can put you to work!
 
We really want to send Rest & The Genesis Project as much money as possible, so can use all the help we can get!

Thank you for your support!

 

If you would like to buy tickets to the show just click on the following link:

http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/286055

story:
FOR LOVE, a midnight-blue romantic comedy

We are thrilled to announce FOR LOVE is being given it's Off Broadway premiere at the legendary Irish Repertory Theatre in NYC prior to it's UK and Irish national tour in April.

But we need your LOVE to bring it across the world!

FOR LOVE has been invited to be part of the incredible UK City of Culture Festival 2013, in April (http://www.cityofculture2013.com) opening in the historic city of Derry at The Derry Playhouse.Following this, the play has been programmed into five prestigious theaters across Ireland.

SHOW YOUR LOVE

This is indeed a very unique opportunity for a new play that was written and produced in New York City by an Irish female writer to platform to a wider audience in Europe and develop the play further. Normally plays by Irish writers come to the US, with government funding but it is rare that a play written by an Irish writer gets to cross the pond in the other direction, and be seen by a wider audience, along with an authentic Irish cast of artists all based in New York City where there is a huge vibrant scene of Irish born, US based writers, actors, directors and artists all promoting Irish culture in their own particular way through their own authentic experience.

WHY LOVE?

While the theaters will be providing some marketing and technical support for the show along with accommodation, we need to raise the funds needed to cover costs for airfares for five actors and a director, and to pay for travel within Ireland, aswell as actors salaries, director salary and rehearsals, expenses including printing of programs and flyers ( which theaters in Ireland do not cover).

We hope you can join us in this exciting ground-breaking adventure!

FOR LOVE

"For a few minutes you made me feel as though I actually meant something to someone"

Ireland is experiencing one of the greatest economic downturns in it’s history, the great recession, and three women in Dublin, are throwing down their handbags and looking for love, no matter what it costs.

FOR LOVE world premiered at this year's 1st Irish Theatre Festival in NYC as part of their New Generation Writers series, we played to sold-out audiences and long waiting lists and had them laughing and crying in the aisles! The play was chosen by the IRISH EXAMINER as "the pick of the festival" 

HELP US BRING LOVE ACROSS THE POND BACK TO THE OLD SOD!

PREMIERING AT UK CITY OF CULTURE 2013 & 5 THEATERS ACROSS IRELAND

The play was written by New York based Irish actress, Laoisa Sexton, who also stars, and features an all Irish cast,(all US based), featuring retired world champion boxer and recently turned actor, John Duddy (formerly The Derry Destroyer) who will be making his debut as an actor in his hometown of Derry. The festival is extremely excited to have us, as John Duddy is a local hero, so they are expecting huge press coverage.The play also features US based award winning Irish actresses, Jo Kinsella (Dancing at Lughnasa) and Georgina mc Kevitt (Waiting for Ikea).

FOR LOVE, A TRAGIC LOVE STORY... sort of!

For Love is a story everyone can relate to…hands up anyone whose ever had a bad experience in the love department? Sick and tired of looking for love and all it’s pitfalls?These women are deep in the trenches, where we have all been at one time or another…Are we ever truly living in the moment or on a forever quest for a higher love, a higher self that only comes to the lucky and the strong…or so it seems?

FOR LOVE is a dark blue comedy, a relentless ride that takes us on a romp through urban sexual experiences of three women in modern day Dublin...Is there more than a one night stand in Val's future? Can Tina find the right dress if she's got the wrong man? Should Bee hop into bed with a married man or just go to the zoo?... Or is there something else out there? Witness what it means to be single to three Irish women, what they will put themselves through and what they will or won’t do…FOR LOVE...

"Refreshing...funny and convincing...hilarious"IRISH EXAMINER

Following it's OFF BROADWAY PREMIERE at

The IRISH REPERTROY THEATRE NYC: March 13- April 5

TOUR DATES & VENUES: UK/ IRELAND APRIL- MAY 2013

DERRY/ UK CITY OF CULTURE 2013 April 5- 13th The Derry Playhouse

BELFAST: April 15-20/21 Grand Opera House 

WATERFORD: April 22/23 Theatre Royal, Waterford

DUBLIN: April 24/ 25 Axis, Ballymun- Dublin

DUBLIN: April 29- May 4  The Viking Theater

OH HOW THEY LOVED...

"FOR LOVE has a refreshing courage and depth of honesty that is both funny and convincing" IRISH EXAMINER

"FOR LOVE features a flawless cast...which takes us on a whirlwind tour of contemporary Dublin nightlife seen from a young woman's perspective in a way that is so authentic and casually funny that it disarms you from the first scene...highly crafted, smart but straight from life...Sexton's female characters are the most interesting and most recognizably Irish I have seen on an Irish stage in years! " IRISH VOICE

"FOR LOVE starts with a bang...refreshing, funny and convincingâ¦the writing is hilarious" IRISH EXAMINER 

"FOR LOVE by Laoisa Sexton is the strongest debut play by an Irish writer I have ever seen"Cahir O'Doherty - IRISH CENTRAL

 OTHER WAYS TO SHOW YOUR LOVE...

Other Ways You Can Help

There are so many ways you can help us get the word out there.

You can help by:

Posting this page on your FACEBOOK wall.

Sharing the promo video on your FACEBOOK wall or email it to your friends and colleagues.

Follow us on Twitter for updates.
https://twitter.com/ForLovetheplay

Like our FACEBOOK page and follow the progress of the production.
http://www.facebook.com/ForLovetheplay

Talk about it to your friends.

Buy a ticket to the show!

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you very much, we really appreciate the support!

WE PROMISE TO LOVE

 

PROMO VIDEO: http://youtu.be/vjbXDP0gQZY

FACEBOOK:http://www.facebook.com/ForLovetheplay

TWITTER:https://twitter.com/ForLovetheplay

PRESS & PROD PHOTOS: http://www.flickr.com/photos/forlovetheplay

Sick and tired of looking for love and all it’s pitfalls?These women are deep in the trenches, where we have all been at one time or another…Are we ever truly living in the moment or on a forever quest for a higher love, a higher self that only comes to the lucky and the strong…or so it seems?
FOR LOVE is a dark blue comedy, a relentless ride that takes us on a romp through urban sexual experiences of three women in modern day Dublin...Is there more than a one night stand in Val's future? Can Tina find the right dress if she's got the wrong man? Should Bee hop into bed with a married man or just go to the zoo?... Or is there something else out there? Witness what it means to be single to three Irish women, what they will put themselves through and what they will or won’t do…FOR LOVE...
"Refreshing...funny and convincing...hilarious"IRISH EXAMINER
Following it's OFF BROADWAY PREMIERE at
The IRISH REPERTROY THEATRE NYC: March 13- April 5
TOUR DATES & VENUES: UK/ IRELAND APRIL- MAY 2013
DERRY/ UK CITY OF CULTURE 2013 April 5- 13th The Derry Playhouse
BELFAST: April 15-20/21 Grand Opera House 
WATERFORD: April 22/23 Theatre Royal, Waterford 
DUBLIN: April 24/ 25 Axis, Ballymun- Dublin 
DUBLIN: April 29- May 4  The Viking Theater
OH HOW THEY LOVED...
"FOR LOVE has a refreshing courage and depth of honesty that is both funny and convincing" IRISH EXAMINER
"FOR LOVE features a flawless cast...which takes us on a whirlwind tour of contemporary Dublin nightlife seen from a young woman's perspective in a way that is so authentic and casually funny that it disarms you from the first scene...highly crafted, smart but straight from life...Sexton's female characters are the most interesting and most recognizably Irish I have seen on an Irish stage in years! " IRISH VOICE
 "FOR LOVE starts with a bang...refreshing, funny and convincingâ¦the writing is hilarious" IRISH EXAMINER 
"FOR LOVE by Laoisa Sexton is the strongest debut play by an Irish writer I have ever seen"Cahir O'Doherty - IRISH CENTRAL

Thank you very much, we really appreciate the support!

story:
“Art is at present the only construction complete unto itself, about which nothing more can be said, it is such richness, vitality, sense, wisdom. Understanding, seeing. Describing a flower: relative poetry more or less paper flower. Seeing.

...I open my heart to creation.” 
― Tristan Tzara
 
Surrealist Burlesque is proud to be returning to historical Coney Island USA as part of the Burlesque at the Beach series on August 23 with it's most epic party and show to date: The Dada Ball!
 
Hosted by “Cabaret Legend” (Le Cool Magazine, Dublin) Armitage Shanks, The Dada ball is an interactive journey through the imaginary intersection of the Dada movement and the Gay Masquerade Balls popularized in the 1910s-1930s. 
 
For more details, please visit facebook  or purchase tickets online.

 

What We Need & What You Get

"Not the old, not the new, but the necessary.” 
― Tristan Tzara
 
We believe that art is necessary; a living, breathing event. It feeds our souls, encourage conversation, and spur on the growth of human kind.
 
However, in order to continue bringing unique and inspiring experiences, fundraising for that art is also necessary.
 
We have partnered with a number of independent artists who embody the spirit of Surrealist Burlesque. By donating to the Dada Ball, you not only assure we can provide an immerssive and inspiring live theatrical experience, but you'll receive unique rewards. Your donation will also ensure that we can offer our artists and performers a fair pay for their work, and allows us to maintain the quality you've come to expect from Surrealist Burlesque.
 
Please help us make the Dada Ball our grandest experiential theater endeavor to date and receive incredible benefits for your support!

Check out these incentives!

$5 Digital thank you card from the Dada Ball

$10 Gigi & Pop’s CD, All Year Long -- click here for a preview!

$15 Dr. Sketchy's Official Rainy Day Colouring Book by Molly Crabapple -- click here for a preview!

$20 High Quality 11’ by 17’ Dada Ball Poster -- click here for a preview!

$30 Handmade Peekaboo Pointe Tasseled Pasties -- click here for a preview!

$50 Two Tickets to Pinchbotom Burlesque Show 

$75 Molar Cufflinks by Gilding Primal Instinct -- click here for a preview!

$100 Two tickets to the Dada Ball, VIP seating, Dada Ball Poster Autographed by the Performers, and Picture with the Cast (available only in person)

$150 “Big Spender” Coney Island USA Membership

$150 Clyde Beatty Circus Poster from Galaxie 13 -- click here for a preview!

$175 Photograph of Roxi D'Lite by Ed Barnas -- click here for a preview!

$200 Custom-Sized Predator Ring by Gilding Primal Instinct -- click here for a preview!

$500 Permanent Surrealist Level Sponsorship!  (Past Surrealist Level Sponsors include Collective Un:Conscious, BritishInk Tattoo, Jim Sally & Vance Baugham)

Other Ways You Can Help

Times are tough.  We know.  Any support you can give is appreciated.  If you can't help financially, please consider helping us spread the word about the Dada Ball.  Click on the "Share" tools & tell your friends.  We thank you for your support.


About Surrealist Burlesque:

Surrealist Burlesque aims to present shows that are epic, multi-disciplinary, collaborations that challenge audiences to experience entertainment with their bodies and their minds.  Surrealist Burlesque shows have been featured in the New York Times, Brooklyn Paper, Animal, Time Out, and many others.  In 2012, Surrealist Burlesque presented Society of the Spectacular, a show inspired by Guy Debord's seminal text, Society of the Spectacle.  The show featured an “intimate theatre” walk through experience in the museum, live interactive music in the Freak Bar, and a show hosted by a television which was given a wine bath in the finale, a Coney Island Sideshow tradition.  As featured in The New York Times, in 2011 Surrealist Burlesque took over the Coney Island complex with “Animal Funhouse” based on George Orwell’s Animal Farm.  With a lush set –including a giant roast pig –and an epic cast of over 20 of New York City’s most spectacular nightlife creatures and burlesque stars, Animal Funhouse presented the largest and most elaborate spectacle ever staged at Coney Island USA.  In 2010, Surrealist Burlesque brought "20,000 Legs Under the Sea" to the Coney Island USA complex.  Inspired by Salvador Dali's “Dream of Venus” at the New York World's Fair (1939-40), “20,000 Legs Under the Sea” invited artists from a range of disciplines to collaborate on sound sculptures, video installations, mini lectures, and live performances.  Other Surrealist Burlesque shows staged at Coney Island include: “Phantasmagoria:  A Land Where All The Beauties are Monsters and All the Monsters are Beauties” (2009) and a durational performance art piece entitled “Coney Island and Spectacle as Total-Body Experience - A 12-Hour Academic Spectacular in Which We Find Our Heroine Chained to a Podium for an Interminable Period, With All the Agony and Sublime Joy That This Might Entail” (2006).

Click here to preview our 2011 production Animal Funhouse -- video by Joel Simpson 

Click here to preview our 2010 show 20,000 Legs Under the Sea -- video by The Great Fredini

story:
Why YA4Ever?

We are YA4Ever and the new branch of the Young Artists Ensemble, run by alumni, for alumni and friends. We created our company to benefit the place from which we all came and loved, YAE.  Young Artists Ensemble began in 1981, and now does and annual Family Theater season as well as Teen Dramas and Teen Summer Musicals. YA4Ever will provide an outlet for alumni of the YAE to do the shows they want to do with the people with whom they want to perform them! After the success of our premiere production of Urinetown, we decided to continue fundraising for YA4Ever. This August we will be doing a production of The Rocky Horror Show, and would love your support! The performing arts is something we all hold near and dear to our hearts, and therefore we are using this production of The Rocky Horror Show and this online campaign to help us raise funds to do more shows in the future. 

The Breakdown

Our goal is $500 and it will go towards future productions to help keep our company up and running, and specifically help us fund technical aspects of this summer's production of The Rocky Horror Show. We are currently rehearsing for our August production of The Rocky Horror Show, and would love to see you all there (for more information go to yaeonine.com or weareya4ever.com). Even if we don't reach our entire goal, the money we raise through this campiagn will still benefit our current production and future shows, so please contribute! All funds for this campaign are run through through the non-profit Arts Council of the Conejo Valley (Tax I.D. 95-310-5047) and the funds will be used exclusively for the YA4Ever production of The Rocky Horror Show. Contributions are tax-deductible to the fullest extent of the law.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute, please join us for our production of The Rocky Horror Show August 15-17 and our first friday midnight show! For ticket information, or more information about Young Artists Ensemble, please visit yaeonline.com

THANK YOU IN ADVANCE FOR YOUR CONTRIBUTION :) Please put correct contact information so that we can get you your perks with ease and velocity!
